page.title: 12ST.MARY'S CHURCH,HAMBLETON.
page.content: St.Mary's church is positioned in St.Mary's Approach just opposite the Old School.People used to go to Brayton Church to worship before St. Mary's was built .In 1872 the Old School was built and on Sundays people could worship there.The first stone of the church was laid in 1881 and in 1882 the church was opened.It cost Â£2012 1s 9d to build.The church is made of brick and the tiles on the belfrey tower are made of wood.The bell is made of bronze and the height to the top of the tower is 40ft.The stained glass windows have all different scenes of Jesus's life. Normally on Sundays there are 40-50 people in the church.There have been 7 vicars counting the present who is called George Greenhough.This year there has been an appeal to raise money to replace the wooden tiles.
